activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter with request for bond change

11:00 AM Defendant Daniel A. Bock in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas Clinton Roley Dr appeared by video for Daniel A. Bock. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Detective Timothy Gensler/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Roley/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Roley willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 11:10 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Court review of case - eligible for PD - counsel has been appointed - will not reduce bond - Defendant in Marathon County on Writ - will have JA reschedule. Bond continued. adj. 01:45 PM
